Emel Hospital is a purpose-built 44 bed hospital situated on a piece of land specially approved for its purpose by the Federal Housing Authority.

Emel Hospital was established in 1988 by Dr. Olufemi Mobolaji-Lawal, a consultant paediatrician. Prior to setting Emel Hospital, he worked for some time as consultant paediatrician at Ikeja General Hospital (now Lagos State University Teaching Hospital), Lagos. He is the board chairman and his wife, Dr. (Mrs) Margaret Mobolaji-Lawal is a non-executive director.

The hospital was declared open on the 9th of December 1988 by the then Honorable Minister of Health of Nigeria, Prof. Olikoye Ransome-Kuti. It is the first private hospital in Lagos, Nigeria to be designated &ldquo;Baby Friendly Hospital&rdquo; by the Federal Ministry of Health in 1993. We are a well-recognized and foremost pediatric referral centre in Amuwo Odofin area and its environs, as well as providing general medical care and specialist services in obstetrics and gynaecology, internal medicine and various surgical specialities.

Our facility is fully computerized and staffed with professionals to deliver excellent primary medical and specialist&#39;s services. We actively promote excellence with a view to ensuring complete client satisfaction at all times.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Festac, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Purpose


	The Human Resources (HR) Manager will lead and oversee the HR function at Emel Hospital, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and compliance with labor laws.
	The role will focus on strategic HR management, policy formulation, talent acquisition, employee engagement, and organizational development, while supervising the HR team, including the Senior HR Officer.


Key Responsibilities
Strategic HR Management:


	Develop and implement HR strategies aligned with Emel Hospital&rsquo;s mission, vision, and operational goals.
	Advise hospital leadership on HR policies, workforce planning, and talent management initiatives.
	Lead organizational change initiatives, workforce restructuring, and HR transformation projects.


Talent Acquisition and Retention:


	Oversee recruitment, selection, and onboarding processes for all staff levels.
	Implement retention strategies, including career development, succession planning, and employee engagement programs.
	Ensure the hospital attracts and retains top talent across clinical and non-clinical functions.


Performance Management:


	Design and manage performance appraisal systems, KPIs, and evaluation processes.
	Support department heads in setting performance standards and achieving departmental goals.
	Drive continuous employee development through training, coaching, and mentorship programs.


HR Policies and Compliance:


	Develop, review, and enforce HR policies, procedures, and employee handbook.
	Ensure compliance with labor laws, healthcare regulations, and internal policies.
	Handle employee relations issues, grievances, and disciplinary actions in line with best practices.


Compensation and Benefits Management:


	Oversee payroll administration, benefits, and incentive programs.
	Benchmark compensation and benefits to maintain competitiveness in the healthcare sector.
	Provide recommendations on remuneration adjustments, promotions, and rewards.


Team Leadership and Development:


	Supervise and mentor HR staff, including the Senior HR Officer.
	Foster a culture of teamwork, accountability, and continuous improvement within the HR department.
	Conduct regular HR audits and provide leadership with insights on workforce trends and challenges.


Qualifications &amp; Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Human Resource Management, Business Administration, or related field; Master&rsquo;s preferred.
	Minimum of 5 - 7 years of progressive HR experience, preferably in healthcare or large organizations.
	Professional HR certification (e.g., CIPM, SHRM-CP, SHRM-SCP) is an advantage.
	Strong knowledge of labour laws, HR best practices, and healthcare regulations.
	Excellent leadership, communication, negotiation, and problem-solving skills.
	Proficient in HR Managementsoftware and Microsoft Office Suite.


Key Competencies:


	Strategic thinking and organizational awareness
	Leadership and people management
	Strong analytical and decision-making abilities
	Conflict resolution and employee engagement
	Confidentiality and ethical conduct.


Method of Application&nbsp;

LD&D Consulting is a project management consulting firm that specialises in turning key projects into success by working collaboratively with clients and key stakeholders. Job Position: Client Service Executive (Media & Advertising Agency)

Employment Type: Full-time

	Act as the primary contact for assigned clients; deliver consistent, high-quality service.
	Build and maintain strong, long-term client relationships.
	Translate client briefs into clear strategies and aligned execution.
	Oversee campaigns, timelines, and deliverables.
	Collaborate with strategy, creative, and media teams on proposals and plans.
	Monitor performance, share insights, and provide strategic recommendations.
	Identify opportunities to grow accounts through upselling and cross-selling.
	Support business development through networking and referrals.
	Manage client feedback and escalations professionally.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Mass Communication, PR, or related field with 3–5 years of experience in a client-facing role within an advertising/marketing/media agency.

	Strong communication, presentation, negotiation, and relationship skills.

Back-End Software Engineer Job at Open Access Consulting Limited




        
    

        
        Open Access Consulting Limited - Our client, a leading company in the Internet Service Provider (ISP) and ICT solutions sector. The organization provides high-speed connectivity, internet solutions, CCTV, and IT support services to homes, offices, hospitals, and schools across Nigeria.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Back-End Software Engineer
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Overview
     

            
    




	The Back-End Software Engineer is to design, develop, and maintain scalable server-side systems that power our internet service products, customer platforms, and internal tools.


Responsibilities


	Write robust, performant, and reusable server-side code.
	Design and maintain databases and APIs consumed by internal and customer applications.
	Collaborate with front-end developers to ensure seamless integration.
	Monitor, troubleshoot, and optimize application performance.
	Implement security best practices and safeguard user data.
	Produce technical documentation and participate in code reviews.


Requirements


	B.Sc/HND in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field.
	Minimum 2+ years of experience in back-end engineering or software development.
	Proven experience with server-side languages and frameworks.
	Solid knowledge of database design and management.
	Understanding of telecom/ISP architecture or related platforms is an advantage.


Skill Set:


	Proficiency in languages such as Python, Node.js, Java, or .NET.
	Strong SQL/NoSQL database experience.
	Good problem-solving, communication, and teamwork skills.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet delivery timelines.


Salary
N3,500,000 - N4,800,000 annually.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: career@openaccessconsult.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
